column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=320.
#Text=Italian Snuffs
#Text=
#Text=Put into a mortar, or other convenient
#Text=vestel, a quantity of Snuff already scented
#Text=with some Flower, pour on it a little White
#Text=Wine, and add, if agreeable, some Essence
#Text=of Ambergrise, Musk, or any other Perfume
#Text=you like best ; stir the Snuff and rub it well
#Text=between your hands.
#Text=Scent Snuff in this
#Text=manner with any particular flavour, and put
#Text=the different scented Snuffs in separate boxes,
#Text=which are to be marked, to prevent mistakes.
#Text=
#Text=321.
#Text=Snuff scented after the Spanish Manner
#Text=
#Text=Take a lump of double-refined Sugar,
#Text=rub it in a mortar with twenty grains of
#Text=Musk; add by little and little a pound of
#Text=Snuff, and grind the whole with ten grains
#Text=of Civet, rubbing it afterwards well between your hands.
#Text=Seville Snuff is scented with twenty
#Text=grains of Vanilloes only.
#Text=Keep your Snuff
#Text=in canisters closely syopped, to prevent the
#Text=scent from exhaling.
#Text=As Spanish Snuff is very fine and of a
#Text=redish colour, to imitate it nicely, take
#Text=the best Dutch Snuff, well cleansed, granulated, and coloured red; beat it fine,
#Text=and sift it through a very fine lawn sieve.
#Text=After it has been cleansed according to the
#Text=foregoing directions, it is fit to take any
#Text=scent whatever.
#Text=There is no rilk in using a sieve that
#Text=retains the scent of any Flower, to perfume
#Text=your Snuff with the flavour of Musk,
#Text= Ambergrise, or any other Perfume.
#Text=On
#Text=the contrary, the Snuff receives the Perfume the more readily, and preserves its
#Text=flavour the longer on that account.
